private_information: Allowed disks: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H where A is smallest and H is larger
I can only move the disks listed above
agent_1.goal: Contribute to the cooperative rearrangement to reach the target peg configuration

private_information: Allowed disks: I,J,K,L,M,N,O where I is smaller and O is largest
I can only move the disks listed above
agent_2.goal: Contribute to the cooperative rearrangement to reach the target peg configuration

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that captures the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the target configuration

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only the top disk of any peg can be moved and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Disks are labeled from smallest to largest as A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O with A smallest and O largest
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom: B,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Middle peg top-to-bottom: A,D. Right peg top-to-bottom: C,E

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are allowed to move only disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H. Use the public information about the environment and follow Tower of Hanoi rules. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect the top-disk and size ordering rules and must only move disks you are allowed to move. Do not emit PDDL. Produce the full sequence of moves your agent will perform to contribute to the global goal.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume missing information. Think step by step.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are allowed to move only disks I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Use the public information about the environment and follow Tower of Hanoi rules. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect the top-disk and size ordering rules and must only move disks you are allowed to move. Do not emit PDDL. Produce the full sequence of moves your agent will perform to contribute to the global goal.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume missing information. Think step by step.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the move sequences produced by agent_1 and agent_2. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and ensure the PDDL encodes which agent is allowed to move each disk. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should be ready for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You received the following move lists: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the inputs, resolve any naming or ordering inconsistencies, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that represents the cooperative planning problem. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure disk ownership constraints are encoded.
